H0.text: Intraspecific competition is the competition that occurs between members of the same species, which improves the species’ adaptations.

H1.text: Interspecies competition is competition that occurs between members of the same species, which improves the species’ adaptations.

H2.text: Commensalism is competition that occurs between members of the same species, which improves the species’ adaptations.

H3.text: Adaptive behavior is competition that occurs between members of the same species, which improves the species’ adaptations.

A4.text: Members of the same species compete for limited resources.

A5.text: Interspecific competition occurs when members of different species compete for a shared resource.
